page.title: 10THE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: There are three councils which govern the Aslockton area. Nottinghamshire County Council, Rushcliffe Borough Council and Cranmer Ward Parish Council. In the Cranmer Ward there are seven Councilors. The meetings are every six weeks and councils are changed every four years. If there are any commplaints, about the roads or any services, the Chairman gets on to Rushcliffe or Nottinghamshire, and they will see to it.The Whatton parish council has seven members. The councillors don't have much power, they set a rate extra to the general rate.The parish of Scarrington has a population of less than a hundred. The parish council is responsible for all the small jobs in the villages; keeping them tidy, controling stray dogs and generally handling all complaints.
